62498fe2-f963-485a-ba03-e0886cd8f8c5.name: rail
62498fe2-f963-485a-ba03-e0886cd8f8c5.desc:
## Payment Settlement Networks

This API manages payment rails and routing configurations for the banking platform:

### üåê Payment Rails
Settlement networks that process and route payment transactions:
- **SWIFT Network**: International wire transfers and cross-border payments
- **ACH Network**: Domestic automated clearing house transactions
- **Internal Rails**: Proprietary settlement systems for instant transfers
- **Card Networks**: Visa, Mastercard, and other payment card processors

### ‚öôÔ∏è Rail Configuration
- Network routing rules and priorities
- Settlement timing and cut-off configurations
- Fee structures per rail and transaction type
- Compliance and regulatory requirements
- Failover and redundancy settings

### üîÑ Transaction Routing
- Intelligent routing based on transaction attributes
- Cost optimization across multiple rails
- Real-time rail status monitoring
- Automatic failover mechanisms

### üìä Rail Analytics
- Transaction volume and success rates
- Settlement timing analytics
- Cost analysis per rail
- Performance monitoring and SLA tracking

---
**Base Path:** `/api/fintech-banking-product/rails`

### üîç Common Use Cases
- Configure new payment rails for different regions
- Set up routing rules for cost optimization
- Monitor rail performance and reliability
- Manage compliance requirements per network

cols.name: theCode
cols.comment: Unique numeric identifier for the payment rail configuration.

cols.name: name
cols.comment: Human-readable name of the payment rail (e.g., 'SWIFT International', 'ACH Domestic', 'Real-time Payments').

cols.name: description
cols.comment: Detailed explanation of the rail's purpose, capabilities, and typical use cases.
cols.data: International wire transfer network for cross-border payments with same-day settlement

cols.name: status
cols.comment: Current operational status of the rail. Values: ACTIVE, INACTIVE, MAINTENANCE, DEPRECATED.

cols.name: enabled
cols.comment: Flag indicating whether this rail is currently available for processing transactions.

cols.name: rules_code
cols.comment: Unique numeric identifier for the payment rail configuration.

status.name: RailStatusEnum

5709f6b3-733d-4b2f-9708-aac9c8ccfb54.name: currency
5709f6b3-733d-4b2f-9708-aac9c8ccfb54.desc:
## Multi-Currency Banking Platform

This API manages currency configurations and exchange rate systems:

### üåç Supported Currencies
ISO 4217 compliant currency management:
- **Major Currencies**: USD, EUR, GBP, JPY, CHF, CAD, AUD
- **Regional Currencies**: ZAR, NGN, KES, GHS, and other local currencies
- **Digital Currencies**: CBDC and stablecoin support where applicable
- **Precious Metals**: Gold, Silver as store-of-value currencies

### üìà Exchange Rate Management
- Real-time exchange rate feeds from multiple providers
- Historical rate tracking and analytics
- Rate spread configuration for different customer tiers
- Mid-market rates with customizable margins
- Rate volatility monitoring and alerts

### üîÑ Currency Conversion
- Automatic currency conversion for cross-border transactions
- Configurable conversion rules and thresholds
- Multi-leg conversion routing for exotic currency pairs
- Conversion fee calculation and application

### ‚öñÔ∏è Regulatory Compliance
- Currency control regulations by jurisdiction
- Capital flow monitoring and reporting
- Anti-money laundering (AML) currency tracking
- Sanctions and embargo compliance

---
**Base Path:** `/api/fintech-banking-product/currencies`

### üîç Common Use Cases
- Add support for new regional currencies
- Configure exchange rate spreads for different customer segments
- Monitor currency exposure and risk
- Set up automated currency hedging rules

cols.name: code_the
cols.comment: Three-letter ISO 4217 currency code uniquely identifying the currency.

cols.name: name
cols.comment: Full descriptive name of the currency as commonly recognized.

cols.name: description
cols.comment: Additional details about the currency, including regional usage or special characteristics.
cols.data: Primary currency of the United States and widely used international reserve currency

cols.name: enabled
cols.comment: Indicates whether this currency is currently supported for new accounts and transactions.

status.name: CurrencyStatusEnum

a9cd563e-aef6-44fc-a842-895c53094714.name: channel
a9cd563e-aef6-44fc-a842-895c53094714.desc:
## Customer Access Channels

This API manages all customer interaction channels and access methods:

### üì± Digital Channels
Modern digital banking touchpoints:
- **Mobile Banking**: iOS and Android native applications
- **Web Banking**: Responsive web application with PWA support
- **API Banking**: RESTful APIs for third-party integrations
- **Chatbot**: AI-powered conversational banking interface
- **Voice Banking**: Voice-activated banking through smart speakers

### üè¢ Physical Channels
Traditional banking touchpoints:
- **Branch Banking**: In-person banking services and consultations
- **ATM Network**: Cash withdrawal, deposits, and basic transactions
- **Kiosk**: Self-service banking terminals in high-traffic areas
- **Phone Banking**: Call center and interactive voice response (IVR)

### üîê Channel Security
- Multi-factor authentication per channel
- Device registration and management
- Session management and timeout policies
- Fraud detection and prevention per channel
- Channel-specific security policies

### ‚öôÔ∏è Channel Configuration
- Service availability per channel
- Transaction limits and restrictions
- Feature flags and A/B testing
- Channel-specific fee structures
- Operating hours and maintenance windows

### üìä Channel Analytics
- Usage patterns and customer preferences
- Channel performance metrics
- Customer journey analytics across channels
- Channel profitability analysis

---
**Base Path:** `/api/fintech-banking-product/channels`

### üîç Common Use Cases
- Configure new digital channels for market expansion
- Set channel-specific transaction limits and fees
- Monitor channel performance and customer satisfaction
- Implement omnichannel customer experiences

cols.name: code
cols.comment: Unique alphanumeric identifier for the customer access channel.

cols.name: name
cols.comment: Display name of the customer channel as shown in user interfaces and reports.

cols.name: description
cols.comment: Comprehensive description of the channel's functionality, supported operations, and target user base.
cols.data: Full-featured web-based banking platform accessible via desktop and tablet browsers

cols.name: active
cols.comment: Flag indicating whether this channel is currently operational and available to customers.

adec5299-d945-4688-a425-c21e33fe6050.name: transactional_fee
adec5299-d945-4688-a425-c21e33fe6050.desc:
## Per-Transaction Fee Management

This API manages fees charged for individual banking transactions:

### üí≥ Transaction Types
Fee structures for different transaction categories:
- **Transfers**: Wire transfers, ACH, internal transfers, international remittances
- **Withdrawals**: ATM withdrawals, over-the-counter cash, online withdrawals
- **Deposits**: Cash deposits, check deposits, electronic deposits
- **Card Transactions**: POS purchases, online payments, contactless payments
- **Bill Payments**: Utility payments, loan payments, third-party bill pay

### üéØ Fee Calculation Models
- **Fixed Fees**: Flat rate per transaction regardless of amount
- **Percentage Fees**: Fee calculated as percentage of transaction amount
- **Tiered Fees**: Different rates based on transaction amount bands
- **Hybrid Fees**: Combination of fixed and percentage components
- **Volume-Based**: Discounts based on transaction frequency or volume

### üè∑Ô∏è Fee Categories
- **Channel-Specific**: Different fees per access channel (mobile, web, ATM, branch)
- **Customer Tier**: Premium, standard, and basic customer fee structures
- **Geographic**: Regional or country-specific fee configurations
- **Time-Based**: Peak hours, weekend, or holiday fee adjustments
- **Product-Specific**: Fees tied to specific account or product types

### ‚ö° Real-Time Processing
- Real-time fee calculation during transaction authorization
- Dynamic fee adjustment based on customer profile and transaction context
- Fee preview before transaction completion
- Transparent fee disclosure and customer notification

### üìä Fee Analytics
- Transaction fee revenue tracking
- Customer fee burden analysis
- Competitive fee benchmarking
- Fee waiver and discount tracking

---
**Base Path:** `/api/fintech-banking-product/transactional-fees`

### üîç Common Use Cases
- Configure fees for new transaction types
- Update fee structures for different customer segments
- Implement promotional fee waivers
- Analyze fee revenue and customer impact

cols.name: tranCode
cols.comment: Unique identifier for the transactional fee configuration.

cols.name: name
cols.comment: Human-readable name for the fee (e.g., 'Internal Transfer Fee').

cols.name: description
cols.comment: Optional explanatory text describing the purpose or rules behind the fee.

cols.name: active
cols.comment: Specifies whether this fee configuration is currently active and enforceable.

66764717-2f5c-4f53-a66e-5c08b59936a5.name: initiation_fee
66764717-2f5c-4f53-a66e-5c08b59936a5.desc: One-time setup and initiation fee configurations applied during account opening, product enrollment, or service activation. These fees are typically charged once per customer lifecycle event.

cols.name: initCode
cols.comment: Unique alphanumeric identifier for the initiation fee configuration, used for system references and fee mapping.

cols.name: name
cols.comment: Business-friendly name for the initiation fee displayed to customers and in financial reports.

cols.name: description
cols.comment: Detailed explanation of when this fee applies, what services it covers, and any conditions or exemptions.
cols.data: One-time fee for premium account activation including enhanced features, priority support, and advanced reporting tools

cols.name: active
cols.comment: Determines whether this initiation fee is currently applied to new account openings and product enrollments.

dd59da13-0fcf-4bd8-bee0-de944b73af3e.name: periodic_fee
dd59da13-0fcf-4bd8-bee0-de944b73af3e.desc: Recurring fee structures applied at regular intervals such as monthly maintenance fees, annual service charges, or subscription-based pricing models for banking products and services.

cols.name: periCode
cols.comment: Unique identifier code for the periodic fee configuration, enabling systematic fee management and reporting.

cols.name: name
cols.comment: Customer-facing name for the periodic fee as it appears on statements and fee schedules.

cols.name: description
cols.comment: Comprehensive explanation of the fee's purpose, billing frequency, calculation method, and any waiver conditions or minimum balance requirements.
cols.data: Monthly service fee for account maintenance and customer support services. Waived with minimum balance of $2,500 or direct deposit enrollment

cols.name: active
cols.comment: Status flag indicating whether this periodic fee is currently being applied to eligible accounts.

5acf4854-34d3-4c05-8c89-8468f9a1a344.name: penalty_fee
5acf4854-34d3-4c05-8c89-8468f9a1a344.desc: Penalty and violation fee configurations applied when customers breach account terms, exceed limits, or trigger specific risk conditions. These fees serve as deterrents and risk mitigation measures.

cols.name: penCode
cols.comment: Unique system identifier for the penalty fee definition, used for automated fee assessment and reporting.

cols.name: name
cols.comment: Clear, customer-understandable name for the penalty fee as displayed on statements and notifications.

cols.name: description
cols.comment: Detailed specification of the conditions that trigger this penalty, the calculation method, maximum frequency, and any grace period or waiver provisions.
cols.data: Fee assessed when account balance falls below zero due to insufficient funds. Applied per occurrence with maximum of 4 fees per day. $35 per incident with 24-hour grace period for deposit corrections

cols.name: active
cols.comment: Operational flag indicating whether this penalty fee is currently enforced for policy violations.

72bb0c46-7bf1-46ce-9591-dcc378de7b55.name: product
72bb0c46-7bf1-46ce-9591-dcc378de7b55.desc:
## Banking Product Management

This API manages the complete lifecycle of banking products and their configurations:

### üì¶ Product Types
Comprehensive range of banking products:
- **Deposit Products**: Savings accounts, current accounts, term deposits, money market accounts
- **Credit Products**: Personal loans, mortgages, credit cards, lines of credit, overdraft facilities
- **Investment Products**: Mutual funds, ETFs, bonds, structured products, wealth management
- **Payment Products**: Debit cards, prepaid cards, payment wallets, merchant services
- **Insurance Products**: Life insurance, general insurance, bancassurance products

### ‚öôÔ∏è Product Configuration
- **Interest Structures**: Fixed vs variable rates, tiered interest, promotional rates
- **Fee Configurations**: Product-specific fee schedules and waiver conditions
- **Limit Management**: Transaction limits, balance thresholds, credit limits
- **Channel Access**: Available channels per product (mobile, web, ATM, branch)
- **Eligibility Criteria**: Age, income, credit score, and other qualification requirements

### üîß Business Rules Engine
- **Automated Decision Making**: Product approval workflows and decision trees
- **Risk Assessment**: Credit scoring, fraud detection, compliance checks
- **Pricing Models**: Dynamic pricing based on customer profile and market conditions
- **Product Bundling**: Cross-selling and upselling rules and recommendations
- **Lifecycle Management**: Product maturity, renewal, and closure processes

### üéØ Customer Segmentation
- **Premium Banking**: High-net-worth individual products and services
- **Mass Market**: Standard retail banking products for general customers
- **SME Banking**: Small and medium enterprise business banking solutions
- **Corporate Banking**: Large enterprise and institutional banking products
- **Youth Banking**: Student accounts and youth-focused financial products

### üìä Product Analytics
- **Performance Metrics**: Product profitability, usage patterns, customer satisfaction
- **Market Analysis**: Competitive positioning, pricing benchmarks, market share
- **Customer Journey**: Product adoption, usage lifecycle, churn analysis
- **Risk Monitoring**: Portfolio risk, concentration limits, stress testing

---
**Base Path:** `/api/fintech-banking-product/products`

### üîç Common Use Cases
- Launch new banking products with comprehensive configurations
- Update existing product features and pricing structures
- Configure business rules for automated decision making
- Analyze product performance and customer behavior

cols.name: code
cols.comment: Unique business identifier for the product used in APIs, reports, and customer communications. Should be descriptive and follow consistent naming conventions.

cols.name: name
cols.comment: Customer-facing display name for the product as shown in marketing materials, applications, and account statements.

cols.name: description
cols.comment: Comprehensive marketing description highlighting key features, benefits, target customer segments, and competitive advantages of the product.
cols.data: High-yield savings account with competitive interest rates, no monthly fees for balances over $10,000, and premium customer support access

cols.name: active
cols.comment: Master switch controlling product availability. When false, the product is hidden from new customer enrollment while maintaining existing accounts.

cols.name: currency
cols.comment: Primary base currency for the product using ISO 4217 currency codes. Determines the default currency for account balances and transactions.

cols.name: channels
cols.comment: Comma-delimited list of customer access channels supported by this product. Controls which touchpoints can be used for account management and transactions.

cols.name: rails
cols.comment: Comma-separated list of payment rail IDs that this product supports for transaction processing. Determines available settlement networks and routing options.

cols.name: category
cols.comment: Product classification for regulatory reporting, risk management, and operational categorization. Values include SAVINGS, CHECKING, MONEY_MARKET, LOAN, CREDIT_LINE.

cols.name: isDefault
cols.comment: Designates this product as the default option for new customer onboarding when no specific product is selected. Only one product per category should be marked as default.

cols.name: fees
cols.comment: Comprehensive fee structure object containing references to applicable transactional, initiation, periodic, and penalty fees. Enables flexible fee bundling and product-specific pricing.

cols.name: routingNumber
cols.comment: ABA routing number or equivalent bank identifier used for wire transfers, ACH transactions, and check processing associated with this product.

cols.name: accountNumberPrefix
cols.comment: Standardized prefix applied to all account numbers generated for this product type. Enables systematic account identification and routing logic.

cols.name: interest
cols.comment: Interest calculation configuration object specifying rates, compounding rules, accrual methods, and payment schedules. Links to interest_configuration for detailed parameters.

cols.name: statement
cols.comment: Statement generation and delivery configuration including frequency, format preferences, electronic delivery options, and retention policies.

cols.name: dormancy
cols.comment: Account dormancy detection and management rules specifying inactivity thresholds, notification procedures, and automated actions to comply with regulatory requirements.

cols.name: limits
cols.comment: Transaction and operational limit configurations including daily/monthly caps, per-transaction maximums, and velocity controls for risk management and regulatory compliance.

cols.name: attributes
cols.comment: Extensible metadata object for storing product-specific feature flags, custom parameters, integration settings, and business logic configurations not covered by standard fields.

category.name: ProductCategoryEnum
category.declaration:
export enum ProductCategoryEnum {
  TRANSACTIONAL = 'TRANSACTIONAL',
  ESCROW = 'ESCROW',
  SAVINGS = 'SAVINGS',
  FLOAT = 'FLOAT',
  SETTLEMENT = 'SETTLEMENT',
}

f92d678c-c897-4484-b476-b902d3931516.name: interest_configuration
f92d678c-c897-4484-b476-b902d3931516.desc: Comprehensive interest calculation and accrual configuration table supporting complex financial instruments and regulatory compliance requirements. Enables sophisticated interest strategies with multiple calculation methods and payment schedules.

cols.name: id
cols.comment: Composite unique identifier object containing tenant context, configuration version, and any hierarchical structure needed for multi-tenant interest management.

cols.name: rate
cols.comment: Annual interest rate expressed as a decimal value. For percentage rates, divide by 100 (e.g., 2.5% = 0.025). Supports up to 6 decimal places for precision.

cols.name: rateCode
cols.comment: Reference identifier linking to external rate sources, benchmark rates, or rate tables. Used for dynamic rate updates and regulatory reporting.

cols.name: calculation
cols.comment: Mathematical method for interest calculation. Options: SIMPLE (principal only), COMPOUND (interest on interest), COMPOUND_CONTINUOUS (continuous compounding for high-frequency calculations).

cols.name: accrual
cols.comment: Frequency and timing for interest accrual calculations. Options: DAILY, WEEKLY, MONTHLY, QUARTERLY, ANNUALLY. Determines how often interest is computed and added to accrued balance.

cols.name: capitalization
cols.comment: Schedule for converting accrued interest into principal balance. Options: DAILY, MONTHLY, QUARTERLY, ANNUALLY, END_OF_TERM. Affects compound interest calculations.

cols.name: dayCountConversion
cols.comment: Day count convention for interest period calculations. Options: ACTUAL_360 (actual days/360), ACTUAL_365 (actual days/365), THIRTY_360 (30 days per month), ACTUAL_ACTUAL (actual days/actual year).

cols.name: active
cols.comment: Operational status flag controlling whether this interest configuration is available for new product assignments and active interest calculations.

cols.name: lastAppliedAt
cols.comment: UTC timestamp recording the most recent successful application of interest calculations using this configuration. Used for auditing and reconciliation processes.

accrual.name: InterestConfigurationAccrualEnum

capitalization.name: InterestConfigurationCapitalizationEnum
capitalization.declaration:
export enum InterestConfigurationCalculationEnum {
  SIMPLE = 'simple',
  COMPOUND = 'compound',
}

export enum InterestConfigurationAccrualEnum {
  DAILY = 'daily',
  MONTHLY = 'monthly',
  ANNUALLY = 'annually',
  BIWEEKLY = 'biweekly',
  SEMIANNUALLY = 'semiannually',
  QUARTERLY = 'quarterly',
  WEEKLY = 'weekly',
}

export enum InterestConfigurationCapitalizationEnum {
  DAILY = 'daily',
  MONTHLY = 'monthly',
  ANNUALLY = 'annually',
  BIWEEKLY = 'biweekly',
  SEMIANNUALLY = 'semiannually',
  QUARTERLY = 'quarterly',
  WEEKLY = 'weekly',
}

dayCountConversion.name: InterestConfigurationDayCountConversionEnum
dayCountConversion.declaration:
export enum InterestConfigurationCalculationEnum {
  SIMPLE = 'simple',
  COMPOUND = 'compound',
}

export enum InterestConfigurationAccrualEnum {
  DAILY = 'daily',
  MONTHLY = 'monthly',
  ANNUALLY = 'annually',
  BIWEEKLY = 'biweekly',
  SEMIANNUALLY = 'semiannually',
  QUARTERLY = 'quarterly',
  WEEKLY = 'weekly',
}

export enum InterestConfigurationCapitalizationEnum {
  DAILY = 'daily',
  MONTHLY = 'monthly',
  ANNUALLY = 'annually',
  BIWEEKLY = 'biweekly',
  SEMIANNUALLY = 'semiannually',
  QUARTERLY = 'quarterly',
  WEEKLY = 'weekly',
}

export enum InterestConfigurationDayCountConversionEnum {
  ACTUAL = 'actual',
  THIRTY360 = 'thirty360',
  THIRTY365 = 'thirty365',
  THIRTYE360 = 'thirtye360',
  THIRTYE365 = 'thirtye365',
  THIRTYEPLUS360 = 'thirtyeplus360',
  THIRTYEPLUS365 = 'thirtyeplus365',
  THIRTYEPLUSACTUAL = 'thirtyeplusactual',
}

db66cef1-da0b-41ce-8bdf-e468eb409fff.name: statement
db66cef1-da0b-41ce-8bdf-e468eb409fff.desc: Statement generation and delivery configuration table managing customer account statements, regulatory reporting requirements, and document retention policies. Supports multiple delivery channels and customizable formatting options.

cols.name: id
cols.comment: Composite identifier structure containing tenant context, product type, and configuration versioning for multi-tenant statement management systems.

cols.name: frequency
cols.comment: Statement generation schedule determining how often account statements are produced. Options: WEEKLY, MONTHLY, QUARTERLY, ANNUALLY, ON_DEMAND. Aligns with regulatory requirements and customer preferences.

cols.name: day
cols.comment: Specific day of the month (1-31) when periodic statements are generated. For monthly statements, day 31 will default to last day of month for shorter months.

cols.name: timeZone
cols.comment: IANA time zone identifier for statement generation scheduling. Ensures consistent timing across geographic regions and daylight saving transitions.

cols.name: type
cols.comment: Statement content and format specification. Options: SUMMARY (basic balance and transaction count), DETAILED (full transaction listing), REGULATORY (compliance-focused), CUSTOM (configurable fields).

cols.name: deliveryMethod
cols.comment: Primary delivery channel for statement distribution. Options: EMAIL, POSTAL_MAIL, SECURE_PORTAL, API_PUSH, SMS_LINK. May support multiple methods with customer preferences.

cols.name: gracePeriodDays
cols.comment: Number of calendar days after statement generation during which delivery attempts continue before marking as failed. Used for retry logic and customer notification escalation.

cols.name: retentionPeriod
cols.comment: Document retention policy for generated statements. Options: THREE_MONTHS, SIX_MONTHS, ONE_YEAR, SEVEN_YEARS, PERMANENT. Must comply with financial regulations and data privacy laws.

frequency.name: StatementFrequencyEnum

type.name: StatementTypeEnum

deliveryMethod.name: StatementDeliveryMethodEnum

retentionPeriod.name: StatementRetentionPeriodEnum

0b6353f6-92c3-45b0-9cd8-b14e08f454c1.name: dormancy
0b6353f6-92c3-45b0-9cd8-b14e08f454c1.desc: Account dormancy detection and management configuration table implementing regulatory compliance for inactive account handling. Defines automated workflows for customer notification, account restrictions, and escheatment processes.

cols.name: id
cols.comment: Composite identifier encompassing tenant, product type, jurisdiction, and configuration version to support regulatory variations across different markets and account types.

cols.name: days
cols.comment: Threshold number of consecutive calendar days without customer-initiated activity that triggers dormancy classification. Must align with state and federal banking regulations.

cols.name: activation
cols.comment: Specific trigger criteria for dormancy evaluation. Options: NO_CUSTOMER_ACTIVITY (any customer action), NO_FINANCIAL_ACTIVITY (transactions only), NO_LOGIN (digital access), BALANCE_BASED (minimum balance thresholds).

cols.name: actions
cols.comment: Automated response configuration array specifying sequential actions taken upon dormancy detection. May include account restrictions, fee assessments, notification escalation, and eventual escheatment procedures.

cols.name: notifyChannels
cols.comment: Multi-channel notification strategy for customer outreach before and after dormancy activation. Includes primary and fallback communication methods with timing and content specifications.

cols.name: tagAsDormant
cols.comment: System flag controlling whether accounts meeting dormancy criteria are automatically marked with dormant status for reporting, compliance monitoring, and operational workflow routing.

activation.name: DormancyActivationEnum

actions.name: DormancyActionsEnum

notifyChannels.name: DormancyNotifyChannelsEnum

6b11cb32-8653-45f7-b595-ee5f0d3cfb85.name: limit
6b11cb32-8653-45f7-b595-ee5f0d3cfb85.desc: Transaction limit and velocity control configuration table for risk management, fraud prevention, and regulatory compliance. Supports complex limit structures with multiple time periods, transaction types, and enforcement actions.

cols.name: id
cols.comment: Multi-dimensional identifier incorporating tenant, currency, product type, customer segment, and configuration version for granular limit management across diverse banking environments.

cols.name: period
cols.comment: Time window for limit enforcement and reset cycles. Options: PER_TRANSACTION, HOURLY, DAILY, WEEKLY, MONTHLY, QUARTERLY, ANNUALLY. Supports both sliding and fixed windows.

cols.name: transactionType
cols.comment: Specific transaction category subject to the limit. Options: PAYMENT, TRANSFER, WITHDRAWAL, DEPOSIT, WIRE, ACH, CHECK, CARD_PURCHASE, ATM_WITHDRAWAL, BILL_PAY. Enables fine-grained control.

cols.name: count
cols.comment: Maximum number of transactions permitted within the specified time period. Used for velocity controls and anti-fraud measures. Zero indicates no count-based restriction.

cols.name: totalValueLimit
cols.comment: Maximum cumulative value allowed for the transaction type within the defined time period.

cols.name: perTransactionLimit
cols.comment: Maximum allowed value for a single transaction.

cols.name: onViolation
cols.comment: Automated system response when limits are exceeded. Options: BLOCK (reject transaction), HOLD (require approval), WARN (allow with alert), ESCALATE (route to review queue), LOG_ONLY (monitor without action).

cols.name: severity
cols.comment: Risk classification level for limit violations, determining alert priority and response protocols. Options: LOW (routine monitoring), MEDIUM (enhanced review), HIGH (immediate intervention), CRITICAL (emergency response).

period.name: LimitPeriodEnum

transactionType.name: LimitTransactionTypeEnum

onViolation.name: LimitOnViolationEnum

severity.name: LimitSeverityEnum

0865a1b6-8023-4007-929b-37a36649ebea.name: fee
0865a1b6-8023-4007-929b-37a36649ebea.desc:
## Complete Fee Management System

This unified API manages all types of fees across the banking platform:

| Fee Type | Description | Documentation Link |
|----------|-------------|-------------------|
| **üîÑ Transactional Fees** | Per-transaction charges for transfers, payments | [üìñ View Docs](/api/docs/transactional-fees) |
| **üéØ Initiation Fees** | One-time setup charges for new services | [üìñ View Docs](/api/docs/initiation-fees) |
| **üìÖ Periodic Fees** | Recurring maintenance and subscription charges | [üìñ View Docs](/api/docs/periodic-fees) |
| **‚ö†Ô∏è Penalty Fees** | Violation and compliance penalty charges | [üìñ View Docs](/api/docs/penalty-fees) |

---

### üîÑ Transactional Fees
Per-transaction charges for banking operations:
- **Transfer Fees**: Wire transfers, ACH, internal transfers, international remittances
- **Withdrawal Fees**: ATM withdrawals, over-the-counter cash, online withdrawals
- **Payment Fees**: Bill payments, card transactions, merchant processing
- **Foreign Exchange**: Currency conversion and cross-border transaction fees
- **Real-time Calculation**: Dynamic fee computation during transaction processing

### üéØ Initiation Fees
One-time setup charges for new services:
- **Account Opening**: Fees for new deposit and credit accounts
- **Card Issuance**: Debit and credit card setup fees
- **Service Activation**: Premium service enrollment fees
- **Product Setup**: Investment account, loan origination fees
- **Documentation**: Statement setup, checkbook issuance fees

### üìÖ Periodic Fees
Recurring charges for account maintenance and services:
- **Monthly Maintenance**: Account keeping fees, minimum balance charges
- **Annual Fees**: Card annual fees, premium service subscriptions
- **Quarterly Charges**: Statement fees, portfolio management fees
- **Subscription Services**: Digital banking features, advisory services
- **Automated Billing**: Scheduled fee collection and customer notification

### ‚ö†Ô∏è Penalty Fees
Charges for policy violations and special circumstances:
- **Overdraft Fees**: Account overdraft protection and coverage fees
- **Late Payment**: Overdue loan payments, credit card late fees
- **Returned Items**: Bounced checks, insufficient funds charges
- **Early Termination**: Account closure, loan prepayment penalties
- **Compliance Violations**: Regulatory breach penalties

### üéõÔ∏è Fee Configuration Engine
- **Multi-Tier Pricing**: Customer segment-based fee structures
- **Geographic Pricing**: Region-specific fee configurations
- **Time-Based Pricing**: Peak hours, weekend, holiday adjustments
- **Volume Discounts**: Transaction frequency and amount-based discounts
- **Promotional Pricing**: Temporary fee waivers and special offers

### üìä Fee Analytics & Reporting
- **Revenue Tracking**: Fee income analysis by type and customer segment
- **Customer Impact**: Fee burden analysis and customer satisfaction metrics
- **Competitive Analysis**: Market positioning and pricing benchmarks
- **Compliance Reporting**: Regulatory fee disclosure and audit trails
- **Optimization Insights**: Fee structure recommendations and A/B testing

---
**Base Path:** `/api/fintech-banking-product/`

### üîç Common Use Cases
- Configure comprehensive fee structures for new markets
- Implement dynamic pricing strategies across all fee types
- Monitor fee revenue and customer impact holistically
- Ensure regulatory compliance across all fee categories

cols.name: id
cols.comment: Composite identifier structure containing tenant context, product association, pricing tier, and configuration versioning for comprehensive fee package management.

cols.name: transactional_fees
cols.comment: Comma-separated list of transactional fee codes that apply to this fee bundle. References fee configurations from the transactional_fee table for per-transaction charges.

cols.name: initiation_fees
cols.comment: Comma-separated list of one-time setup fee codes included in this fee package. References initiation_fee table for account opening and product enrollment charges.

cols.name: periodic_fees
cols.comment: Comma-separated list of recurring fee codes for regular service charges. References periodic_fee table for monthly, quarterly, or annual maintenance fees.

cols.name: penalty_fees
cols.comment: Comma-separated list of penalty fee codes for policy violations and exception conditions. References penalty_fee table for overdraft, returned item, and other violation charges.

dbe714d7-a866-48e7-90f4-1947281acdc4.name: limit_link
dbe714d7-a866-48e7-90f4-1947281acdc4.desc: Limit association and hierarchy management table that links specific limit configurations to customers, products, and organizational scopes. Supports override hierarchies and flexible limit inheritance patterns for complex banking environments.

cols.name: id
cols.comment: Multi-level identifier incorporating tenant, customer segment, product type, currency, and geographic scope to enable sophisticated limit assignment and inheritance structures.

cols.name: customer
cols.comment: Default customer-level limit configuration object that applies across all products unless specifically overridden. Includes base limits, customer segment rules, and fallback enforcement policies.

cols.name: product
cols.comment: Product-specific limit override configuration that takes precedence over customer defaults. Enables tailored limits based on account type, risk profile, and regulatory requirements for specific financial products.

aab110a7-0be3-4349-97fb-0fe287815bcf.name: rules
aab110a7-0be3-4349-97fb-0fe287815bcf.desc: Payment rails configuration table that defines the settlement networks and payment routing mechanisms available for financial transactions. Rails represent the underlying infrastructure used to move money between accounts.

model.desc:
## üè¶ Banking Product Platform Overview

This comprehensive platform manages the complete lifecycle of banking products and services within a modular monolith architecture. Each module represents a distinct business capability that could potentially be extracted as a microservice.

### üéØ Core Business Capabilities

#### üí∞ **Fee Management Ecosystem**
Complete fee lifecycle management across all transaction types:
- **Transactional Fees**: Real-time charges for individual banking operations
- **Initiation Fees**: One-time charges for account setup and service activation
- **Periodic Fees**: Recurring maintenance and subscription charges
- **Penalty Fees**: Compliance and violation-based charges

#### üåê **Infrastructure & Routing**
Mission-critical payment processing infrastructure:
- **Payment Rails**: SWIFT, ACH, and proprietary settlement networks
- **Transaction Routing**: Intelligent cost optimization and failover mechanisms
- **Channel Management**: Multi-channel banking access (mobile, web, ATM, branch)

#### üí± **Multi-Currency Operations**
Global banking with comprehensive currency support:
- **ISO 4217 Compliance**: Full international currency standard support
- **Exchange Rate Management**: Real-time rates and conversion handling
- **Regional Currency Support**: Local and digital currency integration

#### üì¶ **Product Catalog Management**
Comprehensive banking product lifecycle:
- **Deposit Products**: Savings, current, term deposits, money market accounts
- **Credit Products**: Loans, mortgages, credit cards, overdraft facilities
- **Investment Products**: Mutual funds, ETFs, wealth management solutions
- **Payment Products**: Cards, wallets, merchant services

### ‚öôÔ∏è **Business Rules & Configuration**
- **Automated Decision Making**: Rule-based approval workflows
- **Risk Assessment**: Credit scoring and fraud detection
- **Pricing Models**: Dynamic pricing based on customer profiles
- **Compliance Management**: Regulatory requirement enforcement

### üìä **Analytics & Monitoring**
- **Performance Metrics**: Transaction success rates and timing
- **Cost Analysis**: Fee optimization and revenue tracking
- **Customer Journey**: Product adoption and usage lifecycle
- **Risk Monitoring**: Portfolio analysis and stress testing

---
**Base Platform Path:** `/api/fintech-banking-product`

### üîç Common Integration Patterns
- Configure new banking products with comprehensive fee structures
- Set up payment routing for cost optimization and reliability
- Implement multi-currency support for international operations
- Manage customer lifecycle from onboarding to product maturity

### üõ°Ô∏è Security & Compliance
- JWT Bearer authentication across all endpoints
- Regulatory compliance for banking operations
- Data privacy and protection standards
- Audit trails for all financial transactions
model.name: Banking product configuration

docs.name: Rails
docs.summary: Defines the `core banking rails` used for transactions, including their attributes and configurations.

stream.description: The ID of the projection to retrieve and reset. This parameter specifies which projection stream will be targeted by the reset operation.

200.description: The projection was reset successfully. The operation completed without errors and the specified projection stream is now in its initial state.

reset/:stream.description: Resets a specific projection stream to its initial state. Use this endpoint to reinitialize a single projection by its stream identifier.

200.description: All projections were reset successfully. The operation completed without errors and all projection streams are now in their initial state.

reset-all.description: Resets all projection streams in the system to their initial state. Use this endpoint for bulk reinitialization of all projections.

200.description: Metrics for all projections were retrieved successfully.

metrics.description: Retrieves metrics for all projection streams in the system.

docs.name: Currencies
docs.summary: Defines the currencies used in the banking system, including their attributes and configurations.

docs.name: Channels
docs.summary: Defines the channels through which banking services are accessed, including their attributes and configurations.

docs.name: Transactional Fees
docs.summary: Per-transaction charges for transfers, payments, and other banking operations.

docs.name: Initiation Fees
docs.summary: One-time setup charges for new services or account openings.

docs.name: Periodic Fees
docs.summary: Recurring maintenance and subscription charges applied at regular intervals.

docs.name: Penalty Fees
docs.summary: Charges applied for violations or compliance issues.

docs.name: Products
docs.summary: Defines the core banking products available in the system, including their attributes and configurations.

docs.name: Interest Configuration
docs.summary: Defines the interest calculation and application rules for various products.

docs.name: Dormancy Configuration
docs.summary: Manages dormancy rules for accounts, including inactivity periods and notification settings.

docs.name: Limits
docs.summary: Defines transaction limits for products, including counts and values per period.

docs.name: Limit Links
docs.summary: Associates limits with products and customers, enabling dynamic limit management.

docs.name: Statements
docs.summary: Manages periodic statements for accounts, including frequency, delivery methods, and retention.

docs.name: Fees
docs.summary: Comprehensive fee management for transactional, initiation, periodic, and penalty fees.

docs.name: Rules
docs.summary: Defines rules for various operations, including fee calculations, interest applications, and compliance checks.
